security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill contained entirely within SKILL.md. It provides instructional guidance for validating configuration files and environment variables. No executable code, scripts, or binaries are present. The skill uses only standard Claude tools (Read, Grep, Glob, Write, Bash) for file operations and does not access network, sensitive credentials, or system internals.

content.user_title: Validate configuration files and environment variables
content.value_statement: Missing or misconfigured environment variables cause runtime errors and deployment failures. This skill provides systematic methods to find config files, validate required variables, check formats, and ensure documentation stays current.
actual_capabilities: Locate configuration files including .env, config.json, and environment-specific variants
Compare .env.example against .env to detect missing required variables
Validate variable formats including URLs, ports, and boolean values
Generate .env.example templates from existing configuration files
Perform security checks for hardcoded secrets and .gitignore validation
Create documentation for all configuration variables with examples
limitations: Does not modify existing configuration files automatically
Does not connect to external services or APIs
Does not validate secrets or credentials against breach databases
Requires manual review for environment-specific production settings

use_cases.title: Validate dev environment
use_cases.description: Check that all required environment variables are present before starting a development server or running tests.

use_cases.title: Audit production configs
use_cases.description: Review deployment configurations to ensure required variables are documented and properly formatted for production.

use_cases.title: Generate config templates
use_cases.description: Create .env.example files from existing configurations to share with team members and document required settings.

prompt_templates.title: Check for missing variables
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the configuration-validator skill to check my .env file against .env.example. List any missing required variables and suggest defaults.

prompt_templates.title: Validate config formats
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the configuration-validator skill to validate the format of my environment variables. Check for missing quotes, invalid URLs, and type issues.

prompt_templates.title: Generate env template
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the configuration-validator skill to generate a .env.example file from my current .env configuration with placeholder values.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit configs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the configuration-validator skill to check my codebase for hardcoded secrets and verify that .env files are properly gitignored.

output_examples.input: Validate my .env file and check for missing variables against .env.example
output: Format issues found: DATABASE_URL missing quotes around value with spaces
Recommendations: Add API_KEY and JWT_SECRET to your .env file. Wrap values containing spaces in quotes.

best_practices: Always maintain an up-to-date .env.example file that documents all required variables with examples
Validate configuration at application startup to fail fast when required variables are missing
Keep sensitive values out of version control by properly configuring .gitignore
anti_patterns: Committing .env files to version control with real credentials
Using hardcoded secrets or API keys directly in source code
Skipping documentation of optional configuration variables and their defaults

faq.question: What file types does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports .env, .env.example, .env.local, config.json, config.js, settings.py, application.yml, and appsettings.json files.

faq.question: What are the limits on variable validation?
faq.answer: Validates presence, format, and basic type checking. Complex nested configurations or dynamic environment setups require manual review.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing projects?
faq.answer: Works alongside existing configurations by reading files directly. Does not modify your code or require installation of additional dependencies.

faq.question: Is my configuration data safe?
faq.answer: All validation happens locally within your environment. The skill only reads files you specify and does not transmit any data externally.

faq.question: Why is my validation failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing variables in .env, typos in variable names, missing quotes around values with spaces, and incorrect URL formats.

faq.question: How is this different from other config tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on educational guidance and manual validation workflows. Unlike automated tools, it explains why each validation matters and provides context-aware recommendations.
